item.title: Plain Text Diagrams
item.description: Plain Text Diagrams are a way of representing diagrams of code structure and behaviour in a plain text format. This means that you can update and maintain your diagrams in a text editor. They are meant to be easy to read and write, and most importantly, useful. By useful I mean you should be able to read them and gain rapid deep understanding of the source code structure and behaviour that the diagram represents.
